intro: Philadelphus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered mock orange, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its fragrant, white, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has opposite, simple, ovate leaves that are usually hairy beneath. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and wildlife habitat.
